title: Progressive Ag Conference 2018 - Derrick Moot- Unlocking the potential of Lucerne

tasks.task: Conducting Research and Implementing Lucerne Pastures for Drought and Nitrogen Management
subtasks: Discussing the author's transition from farming to climate change research and back to farming solutions.
Presenting experimental data showing the impact of water and nitrogen on pasture growth (up to 22 tonnes DM with added water and nitrogen).
Explaining the role of nitrogen fixation in legumes and the nitrogen efficiency considerations for different pasture types.
Detailing the challenges and benefits of using Lucerne in dryland farming systems.
Covering the life cycle of Lucerne, including establishment, grazing rotations, and management tips.
Presenting case studies of successful Lucerne implementation, highlighting specific examples (Doug Avery, Bog Roy) and their improvement in livestock productivity.
Discussing the importance of matching feed supply with animal demand using high-quality, legume-rich pastures.
Addressing viewer questions on Lucerne suitability in specific climatic conditions, water table management, and rotational grazing intervals.
